required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of an Internet-delivered Treatment Based on Experiential Dynamic Psychotherapy for Social Anxiety Disorder
clinical_study.official_title: Study of an Internet-delivered Treatment Based on Experiential Dynamic Psychotherapy for Social Anxiety Disorder

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this randomized, controlled study is to examine an internet delivered, self-help program for social anxiety based on psychodynamic therapy. The study will compare three conditions: the psychodynamic program with therapist support, without therapist support and a waitlist control.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to post-treatment (8 week) and follow up (6, 12 and 24 months after treatment)
primary_outcome.description: The LSAS-SR features 48 items assessing social anxiety symptoms.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to post-treatment (8 week) and follow up (6, 12 and 24 months after treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: The GAD-7 features seven items for assessing anxiety and screening for generalized anxiety disorder.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to post-treatment (8 week) and follow up (6, 12 and 24 months after treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: The PHQ-9 features nine items for assessing depression in a clinical context and screening of depression in the general population

secondary_outcome.measure: Brunnsviken Brief Quality of Life Scale (BBQ)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to post-treatment (8 week) and follow up (6, 12 and 24 months after treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: The BBQ features 12 items concerning 6 areas of life rated on importance and satisfaction.

other_outcome.measure: The Personality Inventory for DSM Short Form (PID-5)
other_outcome.description: The PID-5 is a self-rated measure of personality-related problems featuring 25 items.

other_outcome.measure: The Difficulties in Emotion Regulation Scale (DERS)
other_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to post-treatment (8 week) and follow up (6, 12 and 24 months after treatment)
other_outcome.description: Features 30 items assessing psychological strategies for handling emotional distress.

other_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline, week 3 and 6, to post-treatment (8 weeks) and follow up (6, 12 and 24 months after treatment)
other_outcome.description: The SCS-SF features 12 items to record self-compassion towards yourself in difficult life situations.

other_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to post-treatment (8 week)
other_outcome.description: DMRS-SR-30 features 30 items assessing psychological factors that influence emotional distress and quality of life.

other_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline, treatment week 1-8, to post-treatment (8 weeks).
other_outcome.description: RFQ features 8 items assessing the ability to understand mental states of the self and others.

other_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline, and week 4, to post-treatment (8 weeks).
other_outcome.description: iiPAS is rated by a clinician and features 5 items assessing a particular patient's adherence to internet-delivered psychological interventions.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Internet delivered self-help program with therapist support
arm_group.description: The intervention consists of 8 therapist-supported self-help modules delivered over 8 weeks on a secure online platform. Modules consist of texts and video followed by exercises which they send to their therapist and receive feedback within a few days. The treatment is based on principles from affect-focused psychodynamic psychotherapy.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Internet delivered self-help program without therapist support
arm_group.description: The intervention consists of 8 self-help modules delivered over 8 weeks on a secure online platform. Modules consist of texts and video followed by exercises which the participants are encouraged to try. The treatment is based on principles from affect-focused psychodynamic psychotherapy.
Participants will receive no intervention for 8 weeks.

intervention.intervention_name: Experimental: Internet delivered self-help program with therapist support
intervention.description: During 8 weeks of treatment participants are taught how emotional conflicts may underlie and perpetuate symptoms of social anxiety. They are also taught how to observe their own anxiety and emotional avoidance (i.e. defenses) and how to gradually approach previously warded off feelings. The final part of the program contains material on how one may express previously warded off emotions to improve important relationships. The treatment program consists of text, videos and a series of experiential exercises which a therapist gives feedback on.
intervention.arm_group_label: Internet delivered self-help program with therapist support

intervention.intervention_name: Internet delivered self-help program without therapist support
intervention.description: During 8 weeks of treatment participants are taught how emotional conflicts may underlie and perpetuate symptoms of social anxiety. They are also taught how to observe their own anxiety and emotional avoidance (i.e. defenses) and how to gradually approach previously warded off feelings. The final part of the program contains material on how one may express previously warded off emotions to improve important relationships. The treatment program consists of text, videos and a series of experiential exercises.
intervention.arm_group_label: Internet delivered self-help program without therapist support

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18 years old or older
- Fulfill the DSM-5 criteria for social anxiety disorder (Score > 60 on the self-assessment instrument LSAS-SR)
- Have access to a computer/smartphone/tablet with internet connection
- Be able to read and write Swedish.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Suicidal (within the previous month, assessed with the self-assessment instrument C-SSRS)
- Partaking in psychological treatment
- Ongoing treatment with psychopharmacological drugs with dose adjustments within the nearest month or planned dose adjustments.
The following self-reported diagnoses are excluded:
- Autism spectrum disorder
- Serious depression (Score â‰¥ 20 on the PHQ9)
- Indications of psychosis or bipolar disorder (type 1 or 2).

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Psychology at Stockholm University

patient_data.ipd_description: Parts will be shared in an open data repository.
